New Records: Nick Castellanos' five walk-offs between the regular season and postseason are tied for the third-most in a single season since 1974.
Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single to left field to score Trea Turner from second base in a 7-6 victory.
Bryce Harper hit a two-run homer to center field in the sixth inning.
Nick Castellanos hit a game-tying solo home run in the sixth inning.
Brandon Nimmo hit a go-ahead homer against Orion Kerkering in the seventh inning.
Bryson Stott hit a 3-2 slider down the right-field line to score the tying run.
Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer in the ninth inning to tie the game.
Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single in the bottom of the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Nick Castellanos expressed his joy and reflected on the significance of the moment with his son.
Phillies manager Rob Thomson praised Castellanos' hitting ability and perseverance.
Bryce Harper commended Castellanos for his continuous fight and work.
Matt Strahm highlighted Castellanos' resilience and veteran presence.
Bryson Stott acknowledged Castellanos as a professional hitter who came up big for the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies' offense struggled initially, swinging at nearly 48.5 percent of pitches out of the zone through five scoreless innings.
Teams that have a 2-0 lead in a best-of-five series have won the series 89 percent of the time, but when the series is tied after two games, the home team has won 66 percent of the time.
